intro: Alsine verna var. propinqua, commonly known as slender alsike clover, is a low-growing annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features trifoliate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, fields, and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution in temperate regions.
